info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 28 at 2:15PM CDT until August 28 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Jo Daviess County in northwestern Illinois... Stephenson County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 214 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gratiot to near Mc Connell to Scioto Mills, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Freeport, Cedarville, Buena Vista, Scioto Mills, Mc Connell, Damascus, Stephenson County Fairgrounds and Red Oak around 220 PM CDT. Oneco and Orangeville around 225 PM CDT. Dakota, Winneshiek, Dakota Dornink Airport and Afolkey around 230 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ridott, Rock Grove, Rock City, Davis and Lake Summerset. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
